snippet: The review was ordered after problems were found in the work of Louis Scarcella, a former Brooklyn homicide detective, including repeated use of the same eyewitnesses.
abstract: Panel of former prosecutors, professors and retired judges has been appointed to review as many as 50 trial convictions involving Louis Scarcella, Brooklyn detective whose work may have sent innocent men to prison;  Robert G M Keating, who is chairman of the mayor's Advisory Committee on the Judiciary, will lead the panel.
lead_paragraph: The review was ordered after problems were found in the work of Louis Scarcella, a former Brooklyn homicide detective, including repeated use of the same eyewitnesses.

headline.main: Panel to Review Up to 50 Trial Convictions Involving a Discredited Detective
headline.print_headline: Panel to Review Up to 50 Trial Convictions Involving a Brooklyn Homicide Detective
